com.srch2.android.http.service

Class Field

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.srch2.android.http.service.Field

  • public final class Field
extends Object
    Represents an attribute of the index. An index is described by its schema, and the schema consists of fields. If an index is compared to the table of an SQLite database, a field is comparable to the column of that table. Each field must be associated with a type--whether it is textual, numerical or geographical--and is identified by the value set when constructing the field as its fieldName. Fields can be searchable, refining, searchable and refining, or geographical. Searchable fields are those whose data associated with the field is matched against the keywords of the search input during a search--they are also textual in type; refining fields, on the other hand, are not matched against the key words of the search input, but are used to do advanced search functionality such as limiting the range of the search results or to do post-processing operations. Geographical fields can be used to do geo-searches.

    Fields are used when constructing an IndexDescription in the Indexable implementation of the method getIndexDescription(). They should not be constructed or used otherwise.

      The type of the data that the field will be associated with.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_BOOST_VALUE

        public static final int DEFAULT_BOOST_VALUE
        Defines the default boost value that searchable fields who boost values are not otherwise set will have.

        Has the constant value of 1.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • createSearchableField

        public static Field createSearchableField(String fieldName,
                          int boost)
        Static factory method for obtaining a searchable field with configurable boost value 'boost'. Data associated with this field must be textual in type and will be searchable whenever a search on the index whose schema includes this field is searched. The data of this field will also be returned with the search results whenever a search is performed.

        The value of the boost argument will be used to calculate the score of the of search results, making this field proportionally more or less relevant than other searchable fields. By default this value is set to one.

        This method will throw an exceptions if the value passed for boost is less than one or greater than one hundred; or if the value of fieldName is null or has a length less than one.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the name identifying the field
        boost - the value to assign to the relevance of this field, relative to other searchable fields
        Returns:
        the searchable field

      • createSearchableField

        public static Field createSearchableField(String fieldName)
        Static factory method for obtaining a searchable field with default boost value of one. Data associated with this field must be textual in type and will be searchable whenever a search on the index whose schema includes this field is searched. The data of this field will also be returned with the search results whenever a search is performed.

        This method will throw an exception if the value of fieldName is null or has a length less than one.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the name identifying the field
        Returns:
        the searchable field

      • createRefiningField

        public static Field createRefiningField(String fieldName,
                        Field.Type fieldType)
        Static factory method for obtaining a refining field. Data associated with this field must be have a type specified by the value of fieldType. The data of this field will be returned with the search results whenever a search is performed, but it will not be matched against the key words of the search input. Using the Query class the data of this field can be used to filter search results, however, such as in limiting the range of values if the field type is numerical.

        This method will throw an exception if the value of fieldName is null or has a length less than one; or if the value of fieldType is null.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the name identifying the field
        fieldType - the type of the field (Field.FieldType.TEXT, Field.FieldType.INTEGER, Field.FieldType.FLOAT, Field.FieldType.TIME, Field.FieldType.LOCATION_LONGITUDE, Field.FieldType.LOCATION_LATITUDE)
        Returns:
        the refining field

      • createSearchableAndRefiningField

        public static Field createSearchableAndRefiningField(String fieldName,
                                     Field.Type fieldType)
        Static factory method for obtaining a field that is both searchable and refining with the searchable component having a the default boost value of one. The data associated with this field will be matched against the search input during a search, can also be used to support advanced search features with the Query class such as limiting the range of the search results, and can also be used to do post-processing operations on the search results.

        This method will throw an exception if the value of fieldName is null or has a length less than one; or if the value of fieldType is null.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the name identifying the field
        fieldType - the type of the field (Field.FieldType.TEXT, Field.FieldType.INTEGER, Field.FieldType.FLOAT, Field.FieldType.TIME, Field.FieldType.LOCATION_LONGITUDE, Field.FieldType.LOCATION_LATITUDE)
        Returns:
        the refining and searchable field

      • createSearchableAndRefiningField

        public static Field createSearchableAndRefiningField(String fieldName,
                                     Field.Type fieldType,
                                     int boost)
        Static factory method for obtaining a field that is both searchable and refining with the searchable component having a the default boost value of one. The data associated with this field will be matched against the search input during a search, can also be used to support advanced search features with the Query class such as limiting the range of the search results, and can also be used to do post-processing operations on the search results.

        The value of the boost argument will be used to calculate the score of the of search results, making this field proportionally more or less relevant than other searchable fields. By default this value is set to one.

        This method will throw an exceptions if the value passed for boost is less than one or greater than one hundred; or if the value of fieldName is null or has a length less than one; or if the value of fieldType is null.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the name identifying the field
        boost - the value to assign to the relevance of this field, relative to other searchable fields
        fieldType - the type of the field (Field.FieldType.TEXT, Field.FieldType.INTEGER, Field.FieldType.FLOAT, Field.FieldType.TIME, Field.FieldType.LOCATION_LONGITUDE, Field.FieldType.LOCATION_LATITUDE)
        Returns:
        the refining and searchable field

      • enableHighlighting

        public Field enableHighlighting()
        Enables highlighting feature for the field. The SRCH2 search server will generate a snippet for this field whenever keywords of the search input match the data associated with this field: for instance, if the data was 'All You Need is Love' and the search input was 'lo' the 'Lo' in 'Love' would be surrounded by HTML tags colorizing this text.

        This method returns the Field itself so that it can have these calls cascaded.
        Returns:
        the corresponding field for cascading method calls
